messages.subject: Re: Mindful Parenting Group?
messages.msgSnippet: ... level ... Tina, We have a group of families who seek to live consensually with our children and our community. It is a yahoogroup: Consensual-Living. You
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "Tina" <zoocrew@...> wrote:
>
> I was wondering if anyone knows of a good group that focuses on
> Mindful Parenting. We/I seem to be pretty secure in the Unschooling
> aspect of my life, but seem to flounder at the Mindful Parenting
level
> and would love to be able to discuss on that aspect of life further.
>
> Any information would be appreciated...
>
> Thanks - Tina
>

Tina,

We have a group of families who seek to live consensually with our
children and our community. It is a yahoogroup: Consensual-Living.
You (and others) are welcome to check it out:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/Consensual-living/?yguid=140240070


This is a copy of the home page:

Consensual living is a process, a philosophy, a mindset by which we
seek to live in harmony with our families and community. It involves
finding mutually agreed upon solutions, where the needs of both parties
are not only considered but addressed. Everyone's wants and needs are
equally valid, regardless of age. Conflicting wants or needs are
discussed and mutually agreeable solutions are created or negotiated
which meet the underlying needs of all parties.


Beginners to this concept are welcome to join this list, living
consensually is an ongoing process of discovery. We ask that you be
open to or on the path toward living consensually. We hope to explore
the issues by asking questions, and sharing our experiences. Parenting
is a sensitive issue for many people but we are all here to practice
this process, and can do so if the environment remains one of respect,
compassion, exploration and understanding.


Pat

messages.messageBody:
I was wondering if anyone knows of a good group that focuses on
Mindful Parenting. We/I seem to be pretty secure in the Unschooling
aspect of my life, but seem to flounder at the Mindful Parenting level
and would love to be able to discuss on that aspect of life further.

Any information would be appreciated...

Thanks - Tina
